DataElement.preferredDefinition: The list that represents the values of the dimensional measurement of a neoplastic lesion.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the longest dimension of a tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having the greater length of two or the greatest length of several.:Dimension; the magnitude of something in a particular direction, especially length or width or height.

Concepts.definition: Having the greater length of two or the greatest length of several.
The magnitude of something in a particular direction, especially length or width or height.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The list that represents the values of the dimensional measurement of a neoplastic lesion.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Less Than or Equal To Fifteen Centimeter

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Less Than or Equal To Fifteen Centimeter
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest is smaller than the other object in one of these ways.: A natural number greater than 14 and less than 16 and the quantity that it denotes.: A basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest is smaller than the other object in one of these ways.
A natural number greater than 14 and less than 16 and the quantity that it denotes.
A basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Less Than or Equal To Ten Centimeter

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Less Than or Equal To Ten Centimeter
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest is smaller than the other object in one of these ways.: A natural number greater than 9 and less than 11 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of nine and one.: A basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest is smaller than the other object in one of these ways.
A natural number greater than 9 and less than 11 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of nine and one.
A basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements, including linear dimensions, volume, and weight, of a patient's tumor.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.:The magnitude of something in a particular direction, especially length or width or height.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.
The magnitude of something in a particular direction, especially length or width or height.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
